observation: I see a country selection page for sign-up with a dropdown that shows 'Select' and is currently opened showing a long list of countries. I can see many countries like Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, etc. at the top of the list. As an elderly user, I need to select a country that will work for this financial service. I should avoid restricted countries like US/UK and pick a visible option from the list.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to select a country from this dropdown. I can see many countries listed and should pick one that's commonly accepted. Indonesia was already selected in previous steps, so I'll select a different country that's visible and likely to be accepted - Japan is a good choice as it's visible in the list and generally accepted by financial services.
ux_issues: Very long scrollable list of countries could be overwhelming for elderly users
No search functionality visible to quickly find a country
Small text size (18px) might be challenging to read
List requires scrolling through many options

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: The dropdown menu is not visible in either screenshot. The country/region selection field shows 'Select' placeholder text in both BEFORE and AFTER states, with no indication that Japan was selected or that any dropdown interaction occurred.
dual_diagnosis.diagnosis: The tap action on Japan country option did not execute properly. Either the dropdown failed to open, the Japan option was not available/visible, or the selection did not register in the UI state.
